alert.note: Alert for Burleigh; Morton (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued November 30 at 1:25PM CST by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...MISSOURI RIVER NEAR BISMARCK AND MANDAN ICING OVER... The Bismarck and Mandan reach of the Missouri River is now seeing sheets of ice form. These sheets of ice have thus far continued to pass through the tight meanders near the University of Mary, but will most likely begin to restrict the river`s flow as they accumulate. As the river channel fills with immobile ice, the river above the immobile ice will see rapid increases in water levels. Since 2010, the river has risen between five and nearly eight feet during the first icing over event for the winter season, often in well under 24 hours. As of Wednesday afternoon, the water level for the Missouri River at Bismarck is 4.1 feet. Given recent history, this would suggest the river will be at a stage of between roughly 9 feet and 12 feet sometime between late Wednesday evening and late Friday afternoon. Flood stage at the Bismarck gage on the Missouri River is 14.5 feet. If you observe problematic high water, please report this to your local emergency management.
